Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with two added white bands; exterior: dot and billet pattern friezes near top of sherd; below, painted decoration consisting of part of goat's antler to right; to right, part of corner pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The proportions on this sherd are slightly unclear. The goat's leg is placed rather close to the frieze above, leaving little room for the goat's rump, back and head. Likewise, the pendant roundel hangs very low in the animal frieze.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0256) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
